entries.title: The best AI writers of 2023: ChatGPT and alternatives
entries.description: AI writing tools can help lighten your workload by writing emails and essays and even doing math. They use artificial intelligence to generate text or answer queries based on user input. ChatGPT is one popular example, but there are other noteworthy AI writers.

entries.title: The Justice Department wants to break up Google's ad business
entries.description: The US DOJ and a handful of states have filed an antitrust lawsuit against the internet giant, accusing it of unlawfully dominating the digital ad tech market.

entries.title: The 5 best ring lights of 2023: Level-up your TikToks
entries.description: The right lighting makes all the difference, especially when shooting a TikTok video, Instagram Reel, or YouTube Short. The best ring lights have multiple brightness levels, Bluetooth remote capabilities, stepless dimming, and more for creating quality content.

entries.title: Samsung can learn a thing (or three) from Oppo's latest foldable
entries.description: Oppo's Find N2 is the latest testament to foldable phone supremacy and Samsung's lack of competition -- at least within the US. Here are three of its features that I hope to see in Samsung's next Z Fold.

entries.title: How to get started with Git on Linux
entries.description: If you've begun your journey as a developer, chances are pretty good you'll need to know how to use Git. Here's an introductory guide that walks you through the basics on Linux.

entries.title: How to clear the cache on your Android phone or tablet (and why you should)
entries.description: Make this process part of your Android maintenance routine.

entries.title: How to enable the temperature and humidity sensor on HomePod Mini
entries.description: It was known that the HomePod Mini had an inactive temperature and humidity sensor, but there was no indication Apple would ever turn it on… until now.

entries.title: Samsung Galaxy S23, new Galaxy Books roll out next week: Everything we know so far
entries.description: Ahead of Samsung Galaxy Unpacked 2023, there's already a promotion to get you up to $100 in credits toward a new Galaxy phone. But you'll have to act fast -- it runs through Feb. 1.

entries.title: ChatGPT Pro is coming: Here's what we know so far
entries.description: Earlier this month OpenAI dropped a waitlist for the pro service. Now it seems that some people have access.

entries.title: 4 ways Windows people get MacOS wrong
entries.description: MacOS is often misunderstood by users coming from other operating systems. Here are four things you need to know if you're considering making the switch.

entries.title: How to set the Gmail app email notifications so you never miss an email
entries.description: If you find yourself missing notifications for incoming emails on Android, the problem might be a particular setting in the Gmail app.

entries.title: What is the Android Files Safe folder and how do you use it?
entries.description: If you have files you want to safeguard on your Android device, there's a feature in the Files app just for you.

entries.title: What is Security Keys for Apple ID and why does it matter?
entries.description: Security Keys for Apple ID provides a powerful additional layer of security your iPhone, iPad or Mac. Here's how it works and how to set it up.

entries.title: Did an SOS satellite icon just appear on your iPhone? Here's why
entries.description: No need to panic.

entries.title: Executives to tech teams: Reinvent us, and make it quick
entries.description: Recession or no recession, businesses are anxious to digitize, an Accenture study finds. 'Technology used to be the disrupter. Now it's the enabler, a certainty in turbulent times.'

entries.title: ChatGPT took an MBA exam. Here's how it did
entries.description: OpenAI's chatbot is set an exam by a Wharton professor, but what does the result mean for the future of education?

entries.title: Windows 10 reminder: IE11 is going away soon, so make sure you are ready
entries.description: IE11 icons will be removed from Start Menu and taskbar in June, but IE's engine Trident will live on in Windows 11.

entries.title: Stop giving your unwanted tech to older relatives. It might not help as much as you think
entries.description: Handing over your old phone to your older relatives is probably not the best way to get them online.

entries.title: Walmart drops price of ASUS VivoBook Pro 14 OLED to less than $450
entries.description: If you're in the market for a robust laptop with an impressive display, this Walmart deal is for you.

entries.title: Samsung Display brings advanced smartphone OLED touch tech to notebooks
entries.description: Samsung Display is launching thinner OLED panels with an embedded touch feature that will highly likely feature on Samsung's new Galaxy Book that will be unveiled at Unpacked 2023.

entries.title: Apple's AV/VR headset will reportedly feature unique eye, hand tracking
entries.description: Apple's highly-anticipated mixed reality device will also allow users to participate in FaceTime calls with realistic VR renderings, according to a new Bloomberg report.

entries.title: Apple's AR/VR headset will reportedly feature unique eye, hand tracking
entries.description: Apple's highly-anticipated mixed reality device will also allow users to participate in FaceTime calls with realistic VR renderings, according to a new Bloomberg report.
